intro: Crotalaria alba, commonly known as the white crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant produces small, white to yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets. Crotalaria alba is characterized by its erect growth habit and is often found in disturbed soils. It has a fibrous root system and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
